text:
701-719 First Avenue at 40th Street, being demolished for construction of Tudor City.

April 1, 1926.

40th Street, north side, at First Avenue, showing No. 351 and the eastern end of Prospect Place at the top of the embankment. This was taken before demolition for Tudor City began.
May 11, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
First Avenue, at and adjoining N.W. corner of 40th Street, after the demolition of the buildings on First Avenue, during the progress of the Tudor City development. Nos. 1-13 Prospect Place, up on the hill, still stand, presenting their rear to
the observer.
March 23, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, a year later.
March 21, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same as No. 2, from a different angle.
March 21, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

the observer.
March 23, 1928.

(1)

March 21, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

First Ave., east side, from East 41st to 40th Streets. Buildings shown are a portion of the New York Edison Co. Plant.

October 26, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

First Ave., west side, north from and including East 40th Street. prominent buildings shown are known as (Tudor City).

About 1929.

Ewing Galloway.

(1)
40th Street, north side, east from the clearing at 315-329 East 40th Street, between Second and First Avenues, showing part of the Tudor City development. August 16, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, east from but not including Second Ave.
April 8, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
A view northward across clearance between 40th and 41st Streets, and showing the Woodstock Tower (320 East 42nd Street) overshadowing the Essex House (325 East 41st Street); both units of Tudor City.
August 16, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
40th Street, north side, east from the clearing at 315-329 East 40th Street, between Second and First Avenues, showing part of the Tudor City development. August 16, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, east from but not including Second Ave.
April 8, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
A view northward across clearance between 40th and 41st Streets, and showing the Woodstock Tower (320 East 42nd Street) overshadowing the Essex House (325 East 41st Street); both units of Tudor City.
August 16, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

A view northward across clearance between 40th and 41st Streets, and showing the Woodstock Tower (320 East 42nd Street) overshadowing the Essex House (325 East 41st Street); both units of Tudor City.
August 16, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
40th Street, north side, west from clearing between First and Second Avenues, seen from a slight elevation. The nearest remaining house is 313 East 40th Street. In the right background may be seen the skeleton of the Daily News Building under construction at 220 East 42nd Street,and in the far background the half-completed Lefcourt Colonial Building
at Madison Avenue and 41st Street.
August 16,1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same,seen from the ground a little farther west.
August 16, 1939.
P. L. Sperr.

(1)
40th Street, north side, west from clearing between First and Second Avenues, seen from a slight elevation. The nearest remaining house is 313 East 40th Street. In the right background may be seen the skeleton of the Daily News Building under construction at 220 East 42nd Street,and in the far background the half-completed Lefcourt Colonial Building
at Madison Avenue and 41st Street.
August 16,1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same,seen from the ground a little farther west.
August 16, 1939.
P. L. Sperr.

324-328 East 40th Street, (rear view) south side, between First and Second Aves., as seen from clearance on the north side of 39th Street. Prominent building shown, is the Woodstock Tower (320 East 42nd Street), a unit of Tudor City.

September 11, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
East 40th Street, north side, west from, but not including First Ave. Note on the right, the retaining wall; on top of which is Prospect Place, (Tudor City).
April 8, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, slightly westward.
April 8, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

East 40th Street, south side, west from (No. 338), but not including First Ave.

October 12, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

East 40th Street, between the East River and First Avenue, showing the chimneys atop the Edison Company electric power plant.

1939

Alexander Alland

This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N. Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.

East 40th Street, west from First Avenue. At the right is the retaining wall of Tudor City. This is built on a bluff that was formerly known as Corcoran's Roost. In the background are the Lefcourt-Colonial, Lincoln and Chanin Buildings.

July 23, 1939
October 3, 1940

P. L. Sperr

East 40th Street, west from First Avenue. At the right is the retaining wall of Tudor City. This is built on a bluff that was formerly known as Corcoran's Roost. In the background are the Lefcourt-Colonial, Lincoln and Chanin Buildings.

July 23, 1939
October 3, 1940

P. L. Sperr
